marytts.unitselection.analysis

Class VoiceDataDumper

  • java.lang.Object
    • marytts.unitselection.analysis.VoiceDataDumper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HnmVoiceDataDumper

    public class VoiceDataDumper
extends Object
    Convenience class to dump relevant data from a unit selection voice to a Praat TextGrid and a wav file for inspection of timeline data in external tools (e.g. Praat, WaveSurfer, etc.)
    Author:
    steiner

    • Method Detail

      • byteswap

        protected int byteswap(int val)
        Parameters:
        val - val
        Returns:
        (((val & 0xff000000) >>> 24) + ((val & 0x00ff0000) >>> 8) + ((val & 0x0000ff00) << 8) + ((val & 0x000000ff) << 24))
        See Also:
        WavWriter.byteswap(int)

      • byteswap

        protected short byteswap(short val)
        Parameters:
        val - val
        Returns:
        ((short) ((((int) (val) & 0xff00) >>> 8) + (((int) (val) & 0x00ff) << 8)))
        See Also:
        WavWriter.byteswap(short)

      • dumpTextGrid

        protected void dumpTextGrid(String fileName)
                     throws IOException
        Dump units to Praat TextGrid. This will have three tiers:
        1. halfphone units, labeled with unit indices;
        2. phone units, labeled with allophones;
        3. basenames, labeled with basename of original utterance.
        Parameters:
        fileName - of new TextGrid
        Throws:
        IOException - if data files cannot be read, or TextGrid cannot be written

      • dumpAudio

        protected void dumpAudio(String fileName)
                  throws IOException
        Adapted from WavWriter.export(String, int, byte[]) and WavWriter.doWrite(String, int)
        Parameters:
        fileName - fileName
        Throws:
        IOException - IOException

      • dumpData

        protected void dumpData(String voiceName)
                 throws Exception
        Get file names from voice config file. Dump relevant data from audio timeline, unit file, etc. to Praat TextGrid and wav file.
        Parameters:
        voiceName - for config file to read (e.g. "bits3")
        Throws:
        Exception - Exception

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
        Main method. Add VOICE jar to classpath, then call with 
         -ea -Xmx1gb -Dmary.base=$MARYBASE VOICE
        or something similar
        Parameters:
        args - voice name (without the Locale) of voice to dump data from
        Throws:
        Exception - Exception
